\title{pyresid Documentation}
\date{Apr 27, 2018}
\release{0.4.1}
\author{Rob Firth}
\newcommand{\sphinxlogo}{\sphinxincludegraphics{pyresid_logo.png}\par}

\begin{document}

\maketitle
\sphinxtableofcontents
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}
\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[height=100\sphinxpxdimen]{{CombinedLogo}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}



Python tools for mining Protein Residues from Fulltext articles using PMC number, ePMC and PDB.
Identify sentences in structural publications that refer to local features of a protein.


\chapter{High-Level Functions}
\label{\detokenize{functions:high-level-functions}}\label{\detokenize{functions::doc}}\label{\detokenize{functions:welcome-to-the-docs-for-pyresid}}\index{identify\_residues() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.identify_residues}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{identify\_residues}}}{\emph{fulltext}, \emph{verbose=False}}{}
Uses Regular Expressions to identify and locate usages of residues within the supplied \sphinxtitleref{fulltext}. Returns a
list of MatchClass objects that contain the start and end of the match within the text, and the matched string.
For compound matches, a list of positions and residues is included in the match, which needs decomposing before
further use.
Based on Ravikumar+ 2012.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fulltext}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} text to be searched for residues.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag to turn on verbose output

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{matches} \textendash{} The matches found within \sphinxtitleref{fulltext}.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
List of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:pyresid.MatchClass}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{MatchClass}}}}} objects

\end{description}\end{quote}


\sphinxstrong{See also:}

\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.locate_residues}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{locate\_residues()}}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.process}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{process()}}}}}

\end{itemize}



\end{fulllineitems}

\index{locate\_residues() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.locate_residues}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{locate\_residues}}}{\emph{source}, \emph{matches}, \emph{decompose=True}, \emph{nlp=None}, \emph{cifscantype='flex'}, \emph{verbose=True}}{}
This function takes the raw list of matches from {\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.identify_residues}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{identify\_residues()}}}}} and augments them
with contextual information and matches them against protein matches also found within the text.

This is a reincarnation of locate\_residues2 (despite the name).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{source}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:pyresid.SourceClass}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SourceClass()}}}}}) \textendash{} Class instance containing the source id and fulltext (and possibly the \sphinxtitleref{spaCy} doc)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{matches}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{List}}) \textendash{} a list of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:pyresid.MatchClass}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{MatchClass}}}}} objects

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{decompose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: True.}}) \textendash{} Whether to turn the “compound” mentions matched into actual residues.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{nlp}} (spaCy model - \sphinxurl{https://spacy.io/usage/models}, optional, default: None) \textendash{} The text model to use to turn the \sphinxtitleref{source.fulltext} into \sphinxtitleref{source.doc}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag to turn on verbose output

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{matches} \textendash{} The matches found within \sphinxtitleref{fulltext}, augmented with contextual information - sentence, prefix
postfix, protein accession id.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
List of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:pyresid.MatchClass}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{MatchClass}}}}} objects

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{process() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.process}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{process}}}{\emph{ext\_id\_list}, \emph{outdir}, \emph{filename='pyresid\_output.json'}, \emph{provider='West-Life'}, \emph{cifscantype='flex'}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{overwrite=False}, \emph{return\_dict=False}, \emph{decompose=True}, \emph{verbose=False}}{}
This wraps the main workhorse functions, taking a list of PMC IDs and mining the resulting fulltext.
output is a json structure (the encoded output of \_locate\_residues saved with MyEncoder), to match
the EBI specifications.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ext\_id\_list}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{List of strings}}) \textendash{} List containing ePMC identifiers used to retrieve the relevant entry. Format is prefix of ‘PMC’
followed by an integer.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{outdir}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Path}}) \textendash{} Directory that will contain the output file.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filename}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}) \textendash{} The structured output JSON file containing the annotations, one line per \sphinxtitleref{ext\_id}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{save}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: True}}) \textendash{} Flag to turn off writing the  JSON. Good for debugging whenm combined with \sphinxtitleref{return\_dict}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{overwrite}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag to determine whether to append (default) or overwrite the json file

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{return\_dict}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag to return the output as a dictionary

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cifscantype}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{\{"flex"}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{"standard"\}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: "flex"}}) \textendash{} Flag passed to \sphinxtitleref{pycifrw} via \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\_locate\_residues2()}}; \sphinxtitleref{scantype} can be \sphinxtitleref{standard} or \sphinxtitleref{flex}.  \sphinxtitleref{standard} provides
pure Python parsing at the cost of a factor of 10 or so in speed.  \sphinxtitleref{flex} will tokenise
the input CIF file using fast C routines.  Note that running PyCIFRW in Jython uses
native Java regular expressions to provide a speedup regardless of this argument.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{context}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: "sent"}}) \textendash{} Flag passed to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\_locate\_residues2()}} to determine the type of context added
to annotations, “sent” uses the spaCy parsed sentences, anything else will use \sphinxtitleref{x}
characters either side of the matched tokens.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag to turn on verbose output

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{(optional) outdict} \textendash{} Dictionary containing the annotations. Good for debugging.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
OrderedDict

\end{description}\end{quote}


\sphinxstrong{See also:}

\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.locate_residues}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{locate\_residues()}}}}}

\end{itemize}



\end{fulllineitems}



\chapter{Candidate Identification Functions}
\label{\detokenize{functions:candidate-identification-functions}}\index{identify\_protein\_ID() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.identify_protein_ID}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{identify\_protein\_ID}}}{\emph{fulltext}, \emph{simple=False}, \emph{infile=None}, \emph{locdir=None}, \emph{verbose=False}}{}
Uses Regular Expressions to find Protein IDs in the, and then cross-checks against the PDB list
of entities.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fulltext}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} text snippet to be searched for residues.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{simple}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag that, if set, will skip the check against the PDB. Generally a bad idea.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{infile}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Path}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{None}}) \textendash{} File to load in order to check candidate PDB entries against. contains the PDB entries -
if \sphinxtitleref{None} defaults to “PDBID.list”

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{locdir}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Path}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: None}}) \textendash{} Directory that contains the infile. If None, default is assumed to be \sphinxtitleref{PDB\_dir}, if this
is not found then will be the user home.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag to turn on verbose output

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{unique\_protiens} \textendash{} Matches found within \sphinxtitleref{fulltext}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Set

\end{description}\end{quote}


\sphinxstrong{See also:}


\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\_identify\_residues()}}
{\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.load_protein_IDs}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{load\_protein\_IDs()}}}}}



\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.check_residue_candidate_validity}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{check\_residue\_candidate\_validity}}}{\emph{cand}, \emph{pattern='{[}a-zA-Z{]}\{3\}\textbackslash{}\textbackslash{}d+/\textbackslash{}\textbackslash{}d+\textbar{}{[}a-zA-Z{]}\{3\}\textbackslash{}\textbackslash{}d+'}, \emph{verbose=False}}{}~\begin{quote}\begin{description}

of entities. Returns a list of MatchClass objects, rather than a list of strings, as in

\chapter{API Iteraction Functions}
\label{\detokenize{functions:api-iteraction-functions}}\index{request\_fulltextXML() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.request_fulltextXML}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{request\_fulltextXML}}}{\emph{ext\_id}}{}
Requests a fulltext XML document from the ePMC REST API. Raises a warning if this is not
possible
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ext\_id}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}) \textendash{} ePMC identifier used to retrieve the relevant entry. Format is prefix of ‘PMC’
followed by an integer.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{r} \textendash{} The response to the query served up by the requests package.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxhref{http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/api/\#requests.Response}{Requests.Response}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{parse\_request() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.parse_request}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{parse\_request}}}{\emph{ext\_id}}{}
Wrapper for {\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.request_fulltextXML}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{request\_fulltextXML()}}}}} that returns a \sphinxtitleref{BeautifulSoup} XML object
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ext\_id}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}) \textendash{} ePMC identifier used to retrieve the relevant entry. Format is prefix of ‘PMC’
followed by an integer.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{soup} \textendash{} BeautifulSoup XML object created from the text response from  {\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.request_fulltextXML}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.request\_fulltextXML()}}}}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxhref{https://www.crummy.com/software/BeautifulSoup/bs4/doc/index.html\#beautifulsoup}{BeautifulSoup}

\end{description}\end{quote}


\sphinxstrong{See also:}


{\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.request_fulltextXML}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{request\_fulltextXML()}}}}}



\end{fulllineitems}



\chapter{Other Functions}
\label{\detokenize{functions:other-functions}}\index{get\_sections\_text() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.get_sections_text}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_sections\_text}}}{\emph{ext\_id}, \emph{remove\_tables=True}, \emph{fulltext=False}, \emph{verbose=False}}{}
Requests fulltext XML from the EBI ePMC web REST API, parses the response into a dict.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ext\_id}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}) \textendash{} ePMC identifier used to retrieve the relevant entry. Format is prefix of ‘PMC’
followed by an integer.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{remove\_tables}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: True}}) \textendash{} Flag to ignore the text found within tables.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fulltext}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag used to return a ‘dumb’ fulltext (rather than that
from {\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.reconstruct_fulltext}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{reconstruct\_fulltext()}}}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag to turn on verbose output

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{text\_dict} \textendash{} Dictionary containing the parsed XML. Each entry corresponds to a Section
in the XML (technically a child of the \sphinxtitleref{\textless{}body\textgreater{}}).

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
OrderedDict

\end{description}\end{quote}


\sphinxstrong{See also:}

\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.request_fulltextXML}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{request\_fulltextXML()}}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.parse_request}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{parse\_request()}}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.reconstruct_fulltext}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{reconstruct\_fulltext()}}}}}

\end{itemize}



\end{fulllineitems}

\index{reconstruct\_fulltext() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.reconstruct_fulltext}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{reconstruct\_fulltext}}}{\emph{text\_dict}, \emph{tokenise=True}, \emph{verbose=False}}{}
Converts a \sphinxstyleemphasis{text\_dict} into a single string or series of tokens in a list of strings.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{text\_dict}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Dict}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{OrderedDict}}) \textendash{} Dictionary containing the parsed XML. Each entry corresponds to a Section
in the XML. Usually an output from {\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.get_sections_text}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_sections\_text()}}}}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tokenise}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag to enable or disable the reconstructed text being returned as spaCy tokens
rather than a string

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag to turn on verbose output

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{fulltext} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{string}) \textendash{} text snippet to be searched for residues.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleemphasis{OR}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{fulltext\_tokens} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{List of strings}) \textendash{} Array of tokens that can be used, for example, to search for
\sphinxstyleemphasis{residue\_mentions}.

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}


\sphinxstrong{See also:}


{\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.get_sections_text}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_sections\_text()}}}}}



\end{fulllineitems}

\index{load\_protein\_IDs() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.load_protein_IDs}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{load\_protein\_IDs}}}{\emph{infile=None}, \emph{locdir=None}}{}
Reads in list of valid (approved and pending) PDB entries.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{infile}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Path}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: None}}) \textendash{} File that contains the PDB entries - defaults to “PDBID.list”

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{locdir}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Path}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: None}}) \textendash{} Directory that contains the infile. If None, default is assumed to be \sphinxtitleref{PDB\_dir}, if this
is not found then will be the user home.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{pdb\_arr} \textendash{} List of valid (approved and pending) PDB entries

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
List of strings

\end{description}\end{quote}


\sphinxstrong{See also:}

\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.combine\_compound\_IDs()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.get\_compound\_IDfiles()}}

\end{itemize}



\end{fulllineitems}

\index{reconstruct\_fulltext() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{reconstruct\_fulltext}}}{\emph{text\_dict}, \emph{tokenise=True}, \emph{verbose=False}}{}

\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {}

in the XML. Usually an output from {\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.get_sections_text}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_sections\_text()}}}}}

\item {}

rather than a string

\item {}

\end{itemize}

\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleemphasis{OR}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{fulltext\_tokens} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{List of strings}) \textendash{} Array of tokens that can be used, for example, to search for
\sphinxstyleemphasis{residue\_mentions}.

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{get\_text() (in module pyresid)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{functions:pyresid.get_text}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyresid.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_text}}}{\emph{ext\_id}, \emph{verbose=False}}{}
A wrapper for {\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.get_sections_text}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_sections\_text()}}}}} that adds additional information
to the \sphinxstyleemphasis{text\_dict}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ext\_id}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}) \textendash{} ePMC identifier used to retrieve the relevant entry. Format is prefix of ‘PMC’
followed by an integer.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: False}}) \textendash{} Flag to turn on verbose output

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{text\_dict} \textendash{} Dictionary containing the parsed XML. Each entry corresponds to a Section
in the XML (technically a child of the \sphinxtitleref{\textless{}body\textgreater{}}). An augmented version of
the \sphinxstyleemphasis{text\_dict} returned by {\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.get_sections_text}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_sections\_text()}}}}} - containing
additional information including spaCy tokens, length in characters and
starting offset.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
OrderedDict

\end{description}\end{quote}


\sphinxstrong{See also:}

\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{functions:pyresid.get_sections_text}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_sections\_text()}}}}}

\end{itemize}



\end{fulllineitems}
